title: Wild Rice, Frankfurters And White Cabbage
summary: Wild Rice, Frankfurters And White Cabbage might be just the main course you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains approximately 28g of protein, 29g of fat, and a total of 778 calories. This gluten free, dairy free, and fodmap friendly recipe serves 1 and costs $2.19 per serving. This recipe is liked by 1 foodies and cooks. It is an affordable recipe for fans of American food. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes around 45 minutes. Head to the store and pick up rice, table spoon of dijon mustard, frankfurters, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the balsamic vinegar you could follow this main course with the Skinny Strawberry Ice Cream as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 89%. This score is spectacular. Try Wild Rice Stuffed Cabbage, Pork and Cabbage with Wild Rice and Spiced Apple, and California Wild Rice & Beef Cabbage Wrap With Crunchy Ricotta Cheese for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Hot Dogs can be paired with Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and rosé Wine. A Gewürztraminer will be great with your basic New York style hot dog with mustard and sauerkraut. For a Chicago-style dog with sour pickles and hot peppers, you might opt for a crisp Riesling. No matter your toppings, a dry rosé almost always works. One wine you could try is Fess Parker Santa Barbara Riesling. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 9 dollars.

productMatches.title: Fess Parker Santa Barbara Riesling
productMatches.description: Floral notes and orange blossoms, commingle with scents of citrus, peach, honeysuckle and light apricot on the nose. On the palate you will find flavors of peach, apricot and citrus. These flavors combine to produce an off-dry, yet well-balanced Riesling.
